Nested SamplingÔÉÅ

Nested Main:ÔÉÅ

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_sampling.import_obsmod(global_params)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to import spectra (model and data) before the inversion

Parameters:

global_params (object) ‚Äì Class containing every input from the .ini file.

Returns:

Return a list of lists with the wavelengths, flux, errors, covariance matrix,

transmission, star flux, systematics and the grids for both spectroscopic and photometric data.

Return type:

main_file (list(array))

Authors: Simon Petrus, Matthieu Ravet and Allan Denis

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_sampling.launch_nested_sampling(global_params)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to launch the nested sampling. We first perform LogL function check-ups. Then the free parameters are counted and the data imported. Finally, depending on the nested sampling methode chosen in the config file, we perform the inversion. (Methods succesfully implemented are Nestle and PyMultinest)

Parameters:

global_params (object) ‚Äì Class containing every input from the .ini file.

Returns:

None

Author: Simon Petrus and Matthieu Ravet

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_sampling.loglike(theta, theta_index, global_params, main_file, for_plot='no')[source]ÔÉÅ

Function that calculates the logarithm of the likelihood. The evaluation depends on the choice of likelihood. (If this function is used on the plotting module, it returns the outputs of the modif_spec function)

Parameters:

  • theta (list) ‚Äì Parameter values randomly picked by the nested sampling

  • theta_index (list) ‚Äì Index for the parameter values randomly picked

  • global_params (object) ‚Äì Class containing every input from the .ini file.

  • main_file (list(list)) ‚Äì List containing the wavelengths, flux, errors, covariance, and grid information

  • for_plot (str) ‚Äì Default is ‚Äòno‚Äô. When this function is called from the plotting functions module, we use ‚Äòyes‚Äô

Returns:

Final evaluated loglikelihood for both spectra and photometry.

Return type:

FINAL_logL (float)

Authors: Simon Petrus, Matthieu Ravet and Allan Denis

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_sampling.prior_transform(theta, theta_index, lim_param_grid, global_params)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function that define the priors to be used for the inversion. We check that the boundaries are consistent with the grid extension.

Parameters:

  • theta (list) ‚Äì Parameter values randomly picked by the nested sampling

  • theta_index (list) ‚Äì Index for the parameter values randomly picked

  • lim_param_grid (list) ‚Äì Boundaries for the parameters explored

  • global_params (object) ‚Äì Class containing every input from the .ini file.

Returns:

List containing all the prior information

Return type:

prior (list)

Author: Simon Petrus, Matthieu Ravet, Allan Denis

Modify Spectra:ÔÉÅ

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.bb_cpd_fct(wav_obs_spectro, wav_obs_photo, flx_mod_spectro, flx_mod_photo, distance, bb_T_picked, bb_R_picked)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to add the effect of a cpd (circum planetary disc) to the models.

Parameters:

  • wav_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Wavelength grid of the data (spectroscopy)

  • wav_obs_photo (array) ‚Äì Wavelength of the data (photometry)

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy)

  • flx_mod_photo (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (photometry)

  • bb_temp (float) ‚Äì Temperature value randomly picked by the nested sampling in K units

  • bb_rad (float) ‚Äì Radius randomly picked by the nested sampling in units of planetary radius

Returns:

(flx_mod_spectro) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy) array : (flx_mod_photo) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (photometry)

Return type:

array

Author: Paulina Palma-Bifani

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.calc_ck(flx_obs_spectro, err_obs_spectro, flx_mod_spectro, flx_obs_photo, err_obs_photo, flx_mod_photo, r_picked, d_picked, alpha=1, analytic='no')[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculation of the dilution factor Ck and re-normalization of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (from the radius and distance or analytically).

Parameters:

  • flx_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the data (spectroscopy)

  • err_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Error of the data (spectroscopy)

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy)

  • flx_obs_photo (array) ‚Äì Flux of the data (photometry)

  • err_obs_photo (array) ‚Äì Error of the data (photometry)

  • flx_mod_photo (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (photometry)

  • r_picked (float) ‚Äì Radius randomly picked by the nested sampling (in RJup)

  • d_picked (float) ‚Äì Distance randomly picked by the nested sampling (in pc)

  • alpha (float) ‚Äì Manual scaling factor (set to 1 by default) such that ck = alpha * (r/d)¬≤

  • analytic (str) ‚Äì = ‚Äòyes‚Äô if Ck needs to be calculated analytically by the formula from Cushing et al. (2008)

Returns:

(flx_mod_spectro) Re-normalysed model spectrum array : (flx_mod_photo) Re-normalysed model photometry float : (ck) Ck calculated

Return type:

array

Author: Simon Petrus

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.doppler_fct(wav_obs_spectro, flx_obs_spectro, err_obs_spectro, flx_mod_spectro, rv_picked)[source]ÔÉÅ

Application of a Doppler shifting to the interpolated synthetic spectrum using the function pyasl.dopplerShift. Note: Observation can change due to side effects of the shifting.

Parameters:

  • wav_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Wavelength grid of the data

  • flx_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the data

  • err_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Error of the data

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum

  • rv_picked (float) ‚Äì Radial velocity randomly picked by the nested sampling (in km.s-1)

Returns:

(wav_obs_spectro) New wavelength grid of the data array : (flx_obs_spectro) New flux of the data array : (err_obs_spectro) New error of the data array : (flx_post_doppler) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum

Return type:

array

Author: Simon Petrus

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.lsq_fct(flx_obs_spectro, err_obs_spectro, star_flx_obs, transm_obs, flx_mod_spectro, system_obs, ccf_method='continuum_unfiltered')[source]ÔÉÅ

Estimation of the contribution of the planet and of the star to a spectrum (Used for HiRISE data)

Parameters:

  • flx_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the data (spectroscopy)

  • err_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Error of the data (spectroscopy)

  • star_flx_obs (n-array) ‚Äì Flux of star observation data (spectroscopy)

  • transm_obs (array) ‚Äì Transmission (Atmospheric + Instrumental)

  • system_obs (n-array) ‚Äì Systematics of the data (spectroscopy)

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy)

Returns:

(cp) Planetary contribution to the data (Spectroscopy) array : (cs) Stellar contribution to the data (Spectroscopy) array : (flx_mod_spectro) New model of the companion array : (flx_obs_spectro) New flux of the data n-array : (star_flx_obs) New star flux of the data array : (systematics)

Return type:

array

Author : Allan Denis

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.modif_spec(global_params, theta, theta_index, wav_obs_spectro, flx_obs_spectro, err_obs_spectro, flx_mod_spectro, wav_obs_photo, flx_obs_photo, err_obs_photo, flx_mod_photo, transm_obs=[], star_flx_obs=[], system_obs=[], indobs=0)[source]ÔÉÅ

Modification of the interpolated synthetic spectra with the different extra-grid parameters. It can perform : Re-calibration on the data, Doppler shifting, Application of a substellar extinction, Application of a rotational velocity, Application of a circumplanetary disk (CPD).

Parameters:

  • global_params (object) ‚Äì Class containing each parameter

  • theta (list) ‚Äì Parameter values randomly picked by the nested sampling

  • theta_index (list) ‚Äì Parameter index identificator

  • wav_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Wavelength grid of the data (spectroscopy)

  • flx_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the data (spectroscopy)

  • err_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Error of the data (spectroscopy)

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy)

  • wav_obs_photo (array) ‚Äì Wavelength grid of the data (photometry)

  • flx_obs_photo (array) ‚Äì Flux of the data (photometry)

  • err_obs_photo (array) ‚Äì Error of the data (photometry)

  • flx_mod_photo (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (photometry)

  • transm_obs (array) ‚Äì Transmission (Atmospheric + Instrumental)

  • star_flx_obs (n-array) ‚Äì Flux of star observation data (spectroscopy)

  • system_obs (n-array) ‚Äì Systematics of the data (spectroscopy)

  • indobs (int) ‚Äì Index of the current observation looping

Returns:

(wav_obs_spectro) New wavelength grid of the data (may change with the Doppler shift) array : (flx_obs_spectro) New flux of the data (may change with the Doppler shift) array : (err_obs_spectro) New error of the data (may change with the Doppler shift) array : (flx_mod_spectro) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy) array : (wav_obs_photo) Wavelength grid of the data (photometry) array : (flx_obs_photo) Flux of the data (photometry) array : (err_obs_photo) Error of the data (photometry) array : (flx_mod_photo) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (photometry)

Return type:

array

Author: Simon Petrus, Paulina Palma-Bifani, Allan Denis and Matthieu Ravet

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.reddening_fct(wav_obs_spectro, wav_obs_photo, flx_mod_spectro, flx_mod_photo, av_picked)[source]ÔÉÅ

Application of a sythetic interstellar extinction to the interpolated synthetic spectrum using the function extinction.fm07.

Parameters:

  • wav_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Wavelength grid of the data (spectroscopy)

  • wav_obs_photo (array) ‚Äì Wavelength of the data (photometry)

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy)

  • flx_mod_photo (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (photometry)

  • av_picked (float) ‚Äì Extinction randomly picked by the nested sampling (in mag)

Returns:

(flx_mod_spectro) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (spectroscopy) array : (flx_mod_photo) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum (photometry)

Return type:

array

Author: Simon Petrus

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.vsini_fct_accurate(wave_obs_merge, flx_mod_spectro, ld_picked, vsini_picked, nr=50, ntheta=100, dif=0.0)[source]ÔÉÅ

A routine to quickly rotationally broaden a spectrum in linear time. Adapted from Carvalho & Johns-Krull 2023 https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2023RNAAS‚Ä¶7‚Ä¶91C/abstract

Parameters:

  • wav_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Wavelength grid of the data

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum

  • ld_picked (float) ‚Äì Limd darkening randomly picked by the nested sampling

  • vsini_picked (float) ‚Äì v.sin(i) randomly picked by the nested sampling (in km.s-1)

  • nr (int) ‚Äì (default = 10) The number of radial bins on the projected disk

  • ntheta (int) ‚Äì (default = 100) The number of azimuthal bins in the largest radial annulus note: the number of bins at each r is int(r*ntheta) where r < 1

  • dif (float) ‚Äì (default = 0) The differential rotation coefficient, applied according to the law Omeg(th)/Omeg(eq) = (1 - dif/2 - (dif/2) cos(2 th)). Dif = .675 nicely reproduces the law proposed by Smith, 1994, A&A, Vol. 287, p. 523-534, to unify WTTS and CTTS. Dif = .23 is similar to observed solar differential rotation. Note: the th in the above expression is the stellar co-latitude, not the same as the integration variable used below. This is a disk integration routine.

Returns:

(flx_mod_spectro) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum

Return type:

array

Author: Allan Denis

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_modif_spec.vsini_fct_fast_rot_broad(wav_obs_spectro, flx_mod_spectro, ld_picked, vsini_picked)[source]ÔÉÅ

Application of a rotation velocity (line broadening) to the interpolated synthetic spectrum using the function extinction.fm07.

Parameters:

  • wav_obs_spectro (array) ‚Äì Wavelength grid of the data

  • flx_mod_spectro (array) ‚Äì Flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum

  • ld_picked (float) ‚Äì Limd darkening randomly picked by the nested sampling

  • vsini_picked (float) ‚Äì v.sin(i) randomly picked by the nested sampling (in km.s-1)

Returns:

(flx_mod_spectro) New flux of the interpolated synthetic spectrum

Return type:

array

Author: Simon Petrus

Likelihood Functions:ÔÉÅ

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_logL_functions.logL_CCF_Brogi(flx_obs, flx_mod)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to compute logL based on the CCF mapping from Brogi et al. 2019 under the assumption of gaussian and spectrally constant noise.

Parameters:

  • flx_obs (array) ‚Äì flux of the observation as a function of wavelength

  • flx_mod (array) ‚Äì flux of the model as a function of wavelength

Returns:

the loglikelihood value

Return type:

float

Author: Matthieu Ravet

Function to compute logL based on the CCF mapping from Zucker 2003 under the assumption of gaussian and spectrally constant noise.

Parameters:

  • flx_obs (array) ‚Äì flux of the observation as a function of wavelength

  • flx_mod (array) ‚Äì flux of the model as a function of wavelength

Returns:

the loglikelihood value

Return type:

array

Author: Matthieu Ravet

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_logL_functions.logL_CCF_custom(flx_obs, flx_mod, err_obs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to compute logL based on the custom CCF mapping from Me under the assumption of gaussian and spectrally constant noise.

Parameters:

  • flx_obs (array) ‚Äì flux of the observation as a function of wavelength

  • flx_mod (array) ‚Äì flux of the model as a function of wavelength

  • err_obs (array) ‚Äì errors of the observation as a function of wavelength

Returns:

the loglikelihood value

Return type:

float

Author: Matthieu Ravet

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_logL_functions.logL_chi2_classic(delta_flx, err)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to compute logL based on the classical chi2 under the assumption of gaussian and spectrally uncorrelated noise.

Parameters:

  • delta_flx (array) ‚Äì residual data-model as a function of wavelength

  • err (array) ‚Äì error (=standard deviation) of the observed spectrum as a function of wavelength

Returns:

(logL) the loglikelihood value

Return type:

float

Author: Matthieu Ravet

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_logL_functions.logL_chi2_covariance(delta_flx, inv_cov)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to compute logL based on the generalized chi2 under the assumption of gaussian and spectrally correlated noise.

Parameters:

  • delta_flx (array) ‚Äì residual data-model as a function of wavelength

  • inv_cov (n-array) ‚Äì inverse of the covariance matrix of the observed spectrum as a function of wavelength

Returns:

the loglikelihood value

Return type:

float

Author: Matthieu Ravet

ForMoSA.nested_sampling.nested_logL_functions.logL_full_covariance(delta_flx, inv_cov)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to compute logL under the assumption of gaussian and spectrally correlated noise. This function is a generalized version of the logL_chi2_covariance and is to be used when dealing with GP extimation of the covariance matrix.

Parameters:

  • delta_flx (array) ‚Äì residual data-model as a function of wavelength

  • inv_cov (n-array) ‚Äì inverse of the covariance matrix of the observed spectrum as a function of wavelength

Returns:

the loglikelihood value

Return type:

float

Author: Matthieu Ravet
